core.constants

Physical and mathematical constants for scientific computing, matching Fortran’s constants.F90.

Optimized for high-performance and HPC use. All constants use NumPy types for speed and compatibility. Fortran-specific file path constants (stdin, stdout, stderr) are omitted as Python uses sys.stdin, sys.stdout, sys.stderr.

Module Contents

Classes

Provides physical and mathematical constants for scientific computing.

class core.constants.Constants

Provides physical and mathematical constants for scientific computing.

All constants are class attributes and use NumPy types for high performance.

pi

The value of pi.

Type:

float

const_e

The value of Euler’s number e.

Type:

float

pio2

pi/2.

Type:

float

twopi

2*pi.

Type:

float

sqrt2

Square root of 2.

Type:

float

euler

Euler-Mascheroni constant.

Type:

float

ii

Imaginary unit (sqrt(-1)).

Type:

complex

c0

Speed of light in m/s.

Type:

float

eps0

Vacuum permittivity (F/m).

Type:

float

mu0

Vacuum permeability (H/m).

Type:

float

hplank

Planck constant (J*s).

Type:

float

hbar

Reduced Planck constant (J*s).

Type:

float

e0

Elementary charge (C).

Type:

float

eV

Electron volt (J).

Type:

float

me0

Electron rest mass (kg).

Type:

float

efrmt, pfrmt, efrmt2x, efrmtA, pfrmtA, ifrmtA, Aefrmt

Format strings for numeric display.

Type:

str

Dictionary of all constant names and values.

Return type:

dict
